item.title: Stocks hit despite growth in Japan
item.description: World stocks tumbled on Monday as doubts about the strength of economic recovery threatened to derail the five-month rally in the global markets.

item.title: Dell joins China Mobile to launch smartphone
item.description: Dell is preparing to enter the smartphone business as mobile handset and computer makers converge on one of the few parts of the personal technology market to showing strong growth and profits

item.title: US claims success in thwarting Taliban
item.description: The US said that Taliban insurgents in Afghanistan had failed in a ferocious bid to derail the country’s Afghanistan’s elections, to be held on Thursday, with a wave of violent attacks.

item.title: Fed and Treasury extend loan facility
item.description: The Federal Reserve and the US Treasury extended a $200bn (£122bn) programme designed to revive the securitisation market, bringing relief to investors concerned that the supply of cheap government financing was set to end.

item.title: Charles Schwab sued over auction-rate securities
item.description: Andrew Cuomo, the New York attorney-general, sued Charles Schwab, the biggest independent broker in the US, over its sales and marketing of auction-rate securities, in the latest stage of his investigation into the collapse of the market

item.title: Reader’s Digest turns to Chapter 11
item.description:
Reader’s Digest Association,
after the venerable staple of doctors’ waiting rooms and middle-class bedside tables, announced plans for a voluntary bankruptcy filingas it became the latest victim of the advertising recession

item.title: Ill winds abate for battered sector
item.description: Wind energy suffered a battering in the financial storm of the past year but, as one of the most mature renewables, it looks set for a period of calm

item.title: CIT gains breathing space to restructure debt
item.description: CIT Group revealed it had won more time to restructure and avert a near-term bankruptcy filing, saying a tender offer for $1bn of the troubled US small business lender’s debt succeeded by a small margin

item.title: Swedbank unveils SKr15bn rights issue
item.description: Sweden’s Swedbank unveiled a fully underwritten SKr15bn rights issue to boost a balance sheet weighed down by rising levels of bad loans to the Baltic region and Ukraine

item.title: China saves face with cheaper iron ore deal
item.description: China signalled a softer stance in its protracted iron ore negotiations with global miners, when it announced a face-saving deal with Australian miner Fortescue Metal
